DataElement.preferredName: Godin Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire Psychometrics Questionnaire Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Total numeric score on the Godin Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire, a psychometric tool that individuals complete as a survey of usual leisure-time exercise habits.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to the Godin Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire, a psychometric tool that individuals complete as a survey of usual leisure-time exercise habits.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Vo value exists.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: Activity that requires physical or mental exertion, especially when performed to develop or maintain fitness.
Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric score on a psychometric questionnaire or survey.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Assessment of psychological variables by the application of mathematical procedures.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Released status approved by CCR on 2/5/2005.
